sec.title: Use of “privacy protection” in the context of a commitment exchange and learning transaction
sec.p: To be able to address privacy protection requirements, one needs to do this in the context of a commitment exchange among an individual learner and a LET provider involving identified purpose and informed consent. Such a set of activities is modelled as a learning transaction, i.e., a set of activities or processes which is initiated either by an individual learner or a LET provider to accomplish and explicitly shared goal and terminated upon recognition of one of the agreed conclusions by all the involved Persons although some of the recognition may be implicit, (e.g., a student drops out of a class or a study programme).
